text: Mask of Tutankhamun: The mask of Tutankhamun is a gold funerary mask of the 18th-dynasty ancient Egyptian pharaoh Tutankhamun. After being buried for over 3,000 years, it was excavated by Howard Carter in 1925 from tomb KV62 in the Valley of the Kings and is now in the Egyptian Museum in Cairo.
The Egyptian Boat to the afterlife: Solar Boat of King Cheops
Ramses II Red Granite Statue: An Egyptian municipality worker disinfects the area around the 3,200-year-old pink-granite colossal statue of King Ramses II
Nefertiti Bust: This replica of the bust of Nefertiti was created in the 1930s and is made of plaster and paint.This was only a sculptor's model, never meant to be a work of art on its own.
Akhenaten Statue Cairo: In this colossal statue, king Akhenaten is depicted wears the Pschent or the Double Crown of Upper and Lower Egypt, as well as the khat headdress.
